intro: Steganthera odontophylla, commonly known as the horned milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in umbels. Its leaves are opposite and have a distinctive waxy texture. Steganthera odontophylla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
